meanings.definition: The act of intercepting or stopping something from reaching its intended destination.
meanings.sent1: The interception of the pass by the defender prevented a goal.
meanings.sent2: The interception of the letter by the spy revealed the secret plan.
meanings.sent3: The interception of the package by the playful dog turned into a game of chase.
meanings.sent4: The interception of the signal by the hacker exposed the security vulnerability.
meanings.sent5: The interception of the missile by the defense system saved the city from destruction.

meanings.definition: The act of catching or seizing something in transit.
meanings.sent1: The interception of the ball by the player led to a touchdown.
meanings.sent2: The interception of the thief by the police prevented a robbery.
meanings.sent3: The interception of the cookie by the sneaky child ended in giggles.
meanings.sent4: The interception of the opportunity by the entrepreneur resulted in a successful business.
meanings.sent5: The interception of the idea by the team sparked a creative project.

meanings.definition: The act of secretly listening to or recording a communication.
meanings.sent1: The interception of the conversation by the spy revealed classified information.
meanings.sent2: The interception of the call by the investigator provided crucial evidence.
meanings.sent3: The interception of the message by the curious sibling led to a surprise party.
meanings.sent4: The interception of the transmission by the agent uncovered a plot.
meanings.sent5: The interception of the code by the analyst decrypted the message.
